rules.name: cc10x-orchestrator-mandatory
rules.description: CRITICAL: cc10x-orchestrator is the MANDATORY entry point for ALL code tasks. AUTO-LOAD when user says: plan, planning, design, architect, roadmap, strategy, build, implement, create, write code, develop, make, review, audit, analyze, assess, evaluate, inspect, examine, debug, fix, error, bug, investigate, failure, broken, issue, problem, troubleshoot, diagnose, validate, verify, check, confirm implementation. Example: User says 'plan a feature' → orchestrator loads automatically → PLAN workflow activates. You MUST load this skill FIRST before any code review, planning, building, debugging, or validation. DO NOT write code directly - use the orchestrator to invoke subagents (component-builder, code-reviewer, integration-verifier). DO NOT skip the orchestrator process. DO NOT bypass orchestrator validation mechanisms.

rules.name: cc10x-no-direct-code-writing
rules.description: CRITICAL: DO NOT write code directly. For BUILD workflow, you MUST invoke subagents in sequence: component-builder → code-reviewer → integration-verifier. Each subagent has a SUBAGENT.md file - read it before invoking. Verify subagent exists before invoking. Check skip conditions before invoking. Writing code directly bypasses TDD cycle, code review, and integration verification.

rules.name: cc10x-actions-taken-tracking
rules.description: CRITICAL: Maintain a running 'Actions Taken' section that tracks: Phase 0 completion (functionality analysis), skills loaded (required + conditional), subagents invoked (with execution mode), skip decisions, and phase completion. Update Actions Taken IMMEDIATELY after each activation. Never proceed to next phase without updating Actions Taken. Verify Actions Taken updated before each phase transition. Before final report, verify ALL phases documented in Actions Taken.

rules.name: cc10x-tdd-enforcement
rules.description: CRITICAL: For BUILD workflow, you MUST use TDD cycle: RED (write failing test first, capture output with exit code) → GREEN (minimal implementation, run test, capture exit code) → REFACTOR (clean up while tests green, verify exit code). Do NOT write code without tests. Do NOT skip the RED phase. Always run tests and capture exit codes. Do NOT mark component complete without seeing test fail then pass.

rules.name: cc10x-subagent-invocation
rules.description: CRITICAL: Do NOT write code directly. For BUILD workflow, you MUST invoke subagents in sequence: component-builder → code-reviewer → integration-verifier. For REVIEW workflow, you MUST invoke analysis subagents (analysis-risk-security, analysis-performance-quality, analysis-ux-accessibility). For PLAN workflow, you MUST invoke planning subagents (planning-architecture-risk → planning-design-deployment). For DEBUG workflow, you MUST invoke bug-investigator → code-reviewer → integration-verifier. Each subagent has a SUBAGENT.md file - read it before invoking. Verify subagent exists before invoking. Check skip conditions before invoking.

rules.name: cc10x-skills-inventory-check
rules.description: CRITICAL: Before proceeding to Phase 3 (subagent invocation), you MUST perform Skills Inventory Check: Read workflow Phase 2 section to get required skills list, check Actions Taken section to verify ALL required skills listed with load status, verify conditional skills listed IF detection logic matched, verify each skill marked as 'loaded successfully' or 'failed to load'. If ANY required skill missing, STOP workflow execution, load missing skill immediately, update Actions Taken, re-run inventory check. Do NOT proceed to Phase 3 until ALL items checked and validated.

rules.name: cc10x-subagents-inventory-check
rules.description: CRITICAL: Before proceeding to Phase 4 (synthesis), you MUST perform Subagents Inventory Check: Read workflow Phase 3 section to get subagent invocation rules, check Actions Taken section to verify ALL subagents that should be invoked are listed, verify execution mode documented (parallel/sequential), verify skip decisions documented with reasons. If ANY required subagent missing, STOP workflow execution, check skip conditions, invoke subagent if skip condition NOT met, update Actions Taken, re-run inventory check. Do NOT proceed to Phase 4 until ALL items checked and validated.

rules.name: cc10x-memory-integration
rules.description: CRITICAL: Use filesystem-based memory (.claude/memory/) for: querying patterns before complexity scoring (load patterns.json ONCE, cache for workflow duration, semantic match with jq, top 3 only), storing patterns after workflow completion (validate patterns first, update accuracy, store only validated patterns with accuracy > 50%), storing user preferences (explicit only, never inferred), storing workflow checkpoints. Load memory-tool-integration skill when needed. Do NOT skip memory integration.

rules.name: cc10x-web-fetch-integration
rules.description: CRITICAL: When external APIs/libraries/frameworks are mentioned, use WebFetch tool to fetch documentation. Load web-fetch-integration skill when needed. Use question-based prompts (not raw content requests). Check cache first (.claude/memory/web_cache/cache_index.json), use cache if valid, fetch if needed. Cache results with appropriate TTL (API specs: 24h, library docs: 48h, framework docs: 48h, standards: 72h). Do NOT skip web fetch integration when external dependencies detected.

app.name: App (All Rules)
app.description: Full-stack patterns, best for e2e features and architecture changes
